page.title: 11EMPLOYMENT
page.content: Apart from the actual village, the homes are fairly scattered. About ten years ago most people would have worked on farms or in the forests. Now many different occupations are represented. Many women are in full-time employment. The majority of people (13) still work on farms,with commuting teachers/lecturers (6+1) next in number:next come shop assistants (6).There are two building contractors and 4 workers,1 lorry contractor,3 drivers,3 secretaries and 3 forestry workers. Three young men are trainee bakers,2 people live and work in the local hotel,2 in the Post Office (1 of whom is a full time postman),and 2 men work with Northern Marts. One bank clerk, one doctor (on locum duty),2 oil-rig workers,several unemployed,retired, and housewives complete the total.
